definition: Minister of Ceremonies in imperial China, one of the Nine Ministers 九卿[jiu3 qing1]
highest/greatest/too (much)/very/extremely
always/ever/often/frequently/common/general/constant
surname Chang

sentences.english: Minister Yin. What are you waiting for?
If you let your eyes exposed to the sun too much you can get cataracts at a young age.
sentences.chinese: 你如果讓你的眼睛太常暴露陽光就可能會得白內障。

sentences.english: However, one should not pray too often.
sentences.chinese: 不管怎麼說，你總不能太常祈禱。

sentences.english: Pulling a friend's leg too often may get you in trouble.
sentences.chinese: 太常對朋友開玩笑也許會造成麻煩。

sentences.english: Spanking a child too often may lessen its impact.
sentences.chinese: 太常打孩子屁股，會減少效果。

sentences.english: Our coach has a hoarse voice because he screamed too much.
sentences.chinese: 我們的教練因爲太常大叫所以聲音沙啞了。

sentences.english: I always knew that the Minister was a man of wisdom.
If you visit her too often , she thinks it is boring .
sentences.chinese: 如果你太常去找她，她會覺得煩膩。

sentences.english: Landslides are a common problem when it rains too often.
sentences.chinese: 太常下雨便會有山崩的問題。

definition: Grand Servant in imperial China, one of the Nine Ministers 九卿[jiu3 qing1]
Supervisor of Attendants in imperial China, one of the Nine Ministers 九卿[jiu3 qing1]
honorific title during Tang to Qing times, approx. "Glorious grand master"
Grand Herald in imperial China, one of the Nine Ministers 九卿[jiu3 qing1]
Director of the Imperial Clan in imperial China, one of the Nine Ministers 九卿[jiu3 qing1]
Commandant of Guards (in imperial China), one of the Nine Ministers 九卿[jiu3 qing1]
Grand Minister of Agriculture in imperial China, one of the Nine Ministers 九卿[jiu3 qing1]
ancient official title
official

pair of annual sacrificial ceremonies held by the emperor in ancient times: one in the southern suburbs of the capital (bringing offerings to Heaven) and another in the northern suburbs (with offerings to Earth)
to offer a libation/person who performs the libation before a banquet/senior member of a profession/important government post in imperial China
governor of a province
to dismiss/to fire/to degrade
deputy
the Nine Ministers (in imperial China)
Minor Treasurer in imperial China, one of the Nine Ministers 九卿[jiu3 qing1]
